content.raw:
Ha, my intuition was completely wrong!  But this still won't work.

On Linux, your suggestion of using std::ofstream works just fine for both files and directories.  However, on Windows, std::ofstream::open works OK for files, but not for directories.

It is actually doesn't change things appreciably here, since we still need all of the infrastructure to support is_directory().  Still, it was an interesting thing to try :).
